newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul sends home rescued N.Korean sailor.
newsitem.headline: Seoul sends home rescued N.Korean sailor.

text.p: A North Korean sailor rescued while drifting off a South Korean island returned home through the border village of Panmunjom on Tuesday, military officials said.
The sailor, Chung Kwang-son, private first class in North Korea's navy, crossed the border and was met by North Korean officers, they said.

The return of Chung was the first goodwill gesture by Seoul towards Pyongyang since already tense relations between the two Koreas worsened after a Northern submarine landed 26 agents on a South Korean beach in September.
Of the 26, 24 have been killed, one has been captured alive and another is still at large.
Chung, 19, was picked up by a South Korean maritime police vessel and taken to the western port city of Inchon on Saturday after his boat drifted into Southern waters.
He was first spotted on Friday about 21 miles (34 km) southwest of South Korea's So Yonpyongdo island, which is close to the border with the communist North, Seoul officials said.
